intro: Arabis pulchra var. duchesnensis, commonly known as the Sierra Valley rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with cruciform flowers. This variety is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils in open, sunny habitats. The plant is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it adapts to cold and arid conditions.
